intro: Psychotria nilgiriensis var. astephana, commonly known as the Nilgiri Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
